trans-unit.source: Data binding
trans-unit.target: Data binding

trans-unit.source: Data binding is a way for your app's UI to display data, and optionally to stay in sync with that data.
trans-unit.target: Data binding is a way for your app's UI to display data, and optionally to stay in sync with that data.

trans-unit.source: Data binding
trans-unit.target: Data binding

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Data binding is a way for your app's UI to display data, and optionally to stay in sync with that data.
trans-unit.target: Data binding is a way for your app's UI to display data, and optionally to stay in sync with that data.

trans-unit.source: Data binding allows you to separate the concern of data from the concern of UI, and that results in a simpler conceptual model as well as better readability, testability, and maintainability of your app.
trans-unit.target: Data binding allows you to separate the concern of data from the concern of UI, and that results in a simpler conceptual model as well as better readability, testability, and maintainability of your app.

trans-unit.source: In markup, you can choose to use either the [{x:Bind} markup extension](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt204783) or the [{Binding} markup extension](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt204782).
trans-unit.target: In markup, you can choose to use either the [{x:Bind} markup extension](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt204783) or the [{Binding} markup extension](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt204782).

trans-unit.source: And you can even use a mixture of the two in the same app—even on the same UI element.
trans-unit.target: And you can even use a mixture of the two in the same app—even on the same UI element.

trans-unit.source: {x:Bind} is new for Windows 10 and it has better performance.
trans-unit.target: {x:Bind} is new for Windows 10 and it has better performance.

trans-unit.source: {Binding} has more features.
trans-unit.target: {Binding} has more features.

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Data binding overview
trans-unit.target: Data binding overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to bind a control (or other UI element) to a single item or bind an items control to a collection of items in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to bind a control (or other UI element) to a single item or bind an items control to a collection of items in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

trans-unit.source: In addition, we show how to control the rendering of items, implement a details view based on a selection, and convert data for display.
trans-unit.target: In addition, we show how to control the rendering of items, implement a details view based on a selection, and convert data for display.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed info, see [Data binding in depth](data-binding-in-depth.md).
trans-unit.target: For more detailed info, see [Data binding in depth](data-binding-in-depth.md).

trans-unit.source: Data binding in depth
trans-unit.target: Data binding in depth

trans-unit.source: Data binding is a way for your app's UI to display data, and optionally to stay in sync with that data.
trans-unit.target: Data binding is a way for your app's UI to display data, and optionally to stay in sync with that data.

trans-unit.source: Data binding allows you to separate the concern of data from the concern of UI, and that results in a simpler conceptual model as well as better readability, testability, and maintainability of your app.
trans-unit.target: Data binding allows you to separate the concern of data from the concern of UI, and that results in a simpler conceptual model as well as better readability, testability, and maintainability of your app.

trans-unit.source: Sample data on the design surface, and for prototyping
trans-unit.target: Sample data on the design surface, and for prototyping

trans-unit.source: It may be impossible or undesirable (perhaps for reasons of privacy or performance) for your app to display live data on the design surface in Microsoft Visual Studio or Blend for Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: It may be impossible or undesirable (perhaps for reasons of privacy or performance) for your app to display live data on the design surface in Microsoft Visual Studio or Blend for Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: In order to have your controls populated with data (so that you can work on your app's layout, templates, and other visual properties), there are various ways in which you can use design-time sample data.
trans-unit.target: In order to have your controls populated with data (so that you can work on your app's layout, templates, and other visual properties), there are various ways in which you can use design-time sample data.

trans-unit.source: Sample data can also be really useful and time-saving if you're building a sketch (or prototype) app.
trans-unit.target: Sample data can also be really useful and time-saving if you're building a sketch (or prototype) app.

trans-unit.source: You can use sample data in your sketch or prototype at run-time to illustrate your ideas without going as far as connecting to real, live data.
trans-unit.target: You can use sample data in your sketch or prototype at run-time to illustrate your ideas without going as far as connecting to real, live data.

trans-unit.source: Bind hierarchical data and create a master/details view
trans-unit.target: Bind hierarchical data and create a master/details view

trans-unit.source: You can make a multi-level master/details (also known as list-details) view of hierarchical data by binding items controls to [CollectionViewSource](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209833) instances that are bound together in a chain.
trans-unit.target: You can make a multi-level master/details (also known as list-details) view of hierarchical data by binding items controls to [CollectionViewSource](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209833) instances that are bound together in a chain.
